count.name: Count
count.description: Counts of objects (for example, lines of code, violations, complex units).

percentage.name: Percentage
percentage.description: Percentage of objects (for example, percentage of lines of code not covered by tests, percentage of violations that are major, percentage of complex units).

accessibility.name: Accessibility violations
accessibility.description: The number of accessibility violations in the web user interface of the software.

commented_out_code.name: Commented out code
commented_out_code.description: The number of lines of code commented out.

complex_units.name: Complex units
complex_units.description: The amount of units (classes, functions, methods, files) that are too complex.

duplicated_lines.name: Duplicated lines
duplicated_lines.description: The amount of lines that are duplicated.

failed_jobs.name: Failed CI-jobs
failed_jobs.description: The number of continuous integration jobs or pipelines that have failed.

loc.name: Size (LOC)
loc.description: The size of the software in lines of code.

long_units.name: Long units
long_units.description: The amount of units (functions, methods, files) that are too long.

manual_test_duration.name: Manual test duration
manual_test_duration.description: The duration of the manual test in minutes

manual_test_execution.name: Manual test execution
manual_test_execution.description: Measure the number of manual test cases that have not been tested on time.

many_parameters.name: Many parameters
many_parameters.description: The amount of units (functions, methods, procedures) that have too many parameters.

metrics.name: Metrics
metrics.description: The amount of metrics from one more quality reports, with specific states and/or tags.

performancetest_duration.name: Performancetest duration
performancetest_duration.description: The duration of the performancetest in minutes

performancetest_stability.name: Performancetest stability
performancetest_stability.description: The duration of the performancetest at which throughput or error count increases.

ready_user_story_points.name: Ready user story points
ready_user_story_points.description: The number of points of user stories that are ready to implement.

scalability.name: Scalability
scalability.description: The percentage of (max) users at which ramp-up of throughput breaks.

slow_transactions.name: Slow transactions
slow_transactions.description: The number of transactions slower than their performance threshold.

source_up_to_dateness.name: Source up-to-dateness
source_up_to_dateness.description: The number of days since the source was last updated.

security_warnings.name: Security warnings
security_warnings.description: The number of security warnings about the software.

suppressed_violations.name: Suppressed violations
suppressed_violations.description: The amount of violations suppressed in the source.

uncovered_branches.name: Test branch coverage
uncovered_branches.description: The amount of code branches not covered by tests.

uncovered_lines.name: Test line coverage
uncovered_lines.description: The amount of lines of code not covered by tests.

unmerged_branches.name: Unmerged branches
unmerged_branches.description: The number of branches that have not been merged to master.

unused_jobs.name: Unused CI-jobs
unused_jobs.description: The number of continuous integration jobs that are unused.

violations.name: Violations
violations.description: The number of violations of programming rules in the software.

anchore.name: Anchore
anchore.description: Anchore image scan analysis report in JSON format

url.name: URL to an Anchore vulnerability report in JSON format or to a zip with Anchore reports in JSON format

details_url.name: URL to an Anchore details report in JSON format or to a zip with Anchore reports in JSON format

landing_url.name: URL to Anchore report in a human readable format

axecsv.name: Axe CSV
axecsv.description: An Axe accessibility report in CSV format.

url.name: URL to an Axe report in CSV format or to a zip with Axe reports in CSV format

landing_url.name: URL to Axe report in a human readable format

azure_devops.name: Azure DevOps Server
azure_devops.description: Azure DevOps Server (formerly known as Team Foundation Server) by Microsoft provides source code management, reporting, requirements management, project management, automated builds, testing and release management.

url.name: URL including organization and project
url.help: URL of the Azure DevOps instance, with port if necessary, and with organization and project. For example: 'https://dev.azure.com/{organization}/{project}'.

wiql.name: Issue query in WIQL (Work Item Query Language)

branches_to_ignore.name: Branches to ignore (regular expressions or branch names)

inactive_days.name: Number of days since last commit after which to consider branches inactive
inactive_days.short_name: number of days since last commit

inactive_job_days.name: Number of days since last build after which to consider pipelines inactive
inactive_job_days.short_name: number of days since last build

test_result.name: Test result
test_result.help: Limit which test results to count. Note: depending on which results are selected, the direction of the metric may need to be adapted. For example, when counting passed tests, more is better, but when counting failed tests, fewer is better.

jobs_to_ignore.name: Pipelines to ignore (regular expressions or pipeline names)
jobs_to_ignore.help: Pipelines to ignore can be specified by pipeline name or by regular expression. Use {folder name}/{pipeline name} for the names of pipelines in folders.

failure_type.name: Failure type
failure_type.help: Limit which failure types to count as failed.

attributes.name: Age of most recent build (in days)
Age of most recent build (in days)
Age of most recent commit (in days)

bandit.name: Bandit
bandit.description: Bandit is a tool designed to find common security issues in Python code.

url.name: URL to a Bandit JSON-report or to a zip with Bandit JSON-reports

landing_url.name: URL to Bandit report in a human readable format

calendar.name: Calendar date
calendar.description: Warn when the date is too long ago. Can be used to, for example, warn when it is time for the next security test.

url.name: URL to a Compose 'outdated' JSON-report or to a zip with Composer 'outdated' JSON-reports

landing_url.name: URL to Composer 'outdated' report in a human readable format

latest_version_status.name: Latest version status
latest_version_status.help: Limit which latest version statuses to show. The status 'safe update possible' means that based on semantic versioning the update should be backwards compatible.

cxsast.name: Checkmarx CxSAST
cxsast.description: Static analysis software to identify security vulnerabilities in both custom code and open source components.

url.name: URL
url.help: URL of the Checkmarx instance, with port if necessary, but without path. For example 'https://checkmarx.example.org'.

gitlab.name: GitLab
gitlab.description: GitLab provides Git-repositories, wiki's, issue-tracking and continuous integration/continuous deployment pipelines.

url.name: GitLab instance URL
url.help: URL of the GitLab instance, with port if necessary, but without path. For example, 'https://gitlab.com'.

branches_to_ignore.name: Branches to ignore (regular expressions or branch names)

inactive_days.name: Number of days since last commit after which to consider branches inactive
inactive_days.short_name: number of days since last commit

inactive_job_days.name: Number of days without builds after which to consider CI-jobs unused.

failure_type.name: Failure type
failure_type.help: Limit which failure types to count as failed.

attributes.name: Age of most recent build (in days)
Age of most recent commit (in days)
Age of most recent build (in days)

jacoco.name: JaCoCo
jacoco.description: JaCoCo is an open-source tool for measuring and reporting Java code coverage.

url.name: URL to a JaCoCo report in XML format or to a zip with JaCoCo reports in XML format

landing_url.name: URL to a JaCoCo report in a human readable format

jenkins.name: Jenkins
jenkins.description: Jenkins is an open source continuous integration/continuous deployment server.

url.name: URL
url.help: URL of the Jenkins instance, with port if necessary, but without path. For example, 'https://jenkins.example.org'.

inactive_days.name: Number of days without builds after which to consider CI-jobs unused.

jobs_to_ignore.name: Jobs to ignore (regular expressions or job names)
jobs_to_ignore.help: Jobs to ignore can be specified by job name or by regular expression. Use {parent job name}/{child job name} for the names of nested jobs.

failure_type.name: Failure type
failure_type.help: Limit which failure types to count as failed.

attributes.name: Age of most recent build (in days)
Age of most recent build (in days)

jacoco_jenkins_plugin.name: JaCoCo Jenkins plugin
jacoco_jenkins_plugin.description: A Jenkins job with a JaCoCo coverage report produced by the JaCoCo Jenkins plugin.

url.name: URL to job
url.help: URL to a Jenkins job with a coverage report generated by the JaCoCo plugin. For example, 'http://jenkins.example.org/job/jacoco' or http://jenkins.example.org/job/jacoco/job/master' in case of a pipeline job.

jenkins_test_report.name: Jenkins test report
jenkins_test_report.description: A Jenkins job with test results.

url.name: URL to job
url.help: URL to a Jenkins job with a test report generated by the JUnit plugin. For example, 'http://jenkins.example.org/job/test' or http://jenkins.example.org/job/test/job/master' in case of a pipeline job.

test_result.name: Test result
test_result.help: Limit which test results to count. Note: depending on which results are selected, the direction of the metric may need to be adapted. For example, when counting passed tests, more is better, but when counting failed tests, fewer is better.

jira.name: Jira
jira.description: Jira is a proprietary issue tracker developed by Atlassian supporting bug tracking and agile project management.

url.name: URL
url.help: URL of the Jira instance, with port if necessary. For example, 'https://jira.example.org'.

jql.name: Issue query in JQL (Jira Query Language)

manual_test_duration_field.name: Manual test duration field (name or id)

manual_test_execution_frequency_field.name: Manual test execution frequency field (name or id)

manual_test_execution_frequency_default.name: Default expected manual test execution frequency (days)
manual_test_execution_frequency_default.short_name: default expected manual test execution frequency
manual_test_execution_frequency_default.help: Specify how often the manual tests should be executed. For example, if the sprint length is three weeks, manual tests should be executed at least once every 21 days.

junit.name: JUnit XML report
junit.description: Test reports in the JUnit XML format.

landing_url.name: URL to a JUnit report in a human readable format

test_result.help: Limit which test results to count. Note: depending on which results are selected, the direction of the metric may need to be adapted. For example, when counting passed tests, more is better, but when counting failed tests, fewer is better.

url.name: URL to a NCover report in HTML format or to a zip with NCover reports in HTML format

openvas.name: OpenVAS
openvas.description: OpenVAS (Open Vulnerability Assessment System) is a software framework of several services and tools offering vulnerability scanning and vulnerability management.

url.name: URL to an OpenVAS report in XML format or to a zip with OpenVAS reports in XML format

owasp_dependency_check.description: Dependency-Check is a utility that identifies project dependencies and checks if there are any known, publicly disclosed, vulnerabilities.

owasp_dependency_check_jenkins_plugin.description: Jenkins plugin for the OWASP Dependency Check, a utility that identifies project dependencies and checks if there are any known, publicly disclosed, vulnerabilities.

owasp_zap.description: The OWASP Zed Attack Proxy (ZAP) can help automatically find security vulnerabilities in web applications while the application is being developed and tested.

performancetest_runner.description: An open source tool to run performancetests and create performancetest reports.

test_result.help: Limit which test results to count. Note: depending on which results are selected, the direction of the metric may need to be adapted. For example, when counting passed tests, more is better, but when counting failed tests, fewer is better.

pyupio_safety.name: Pyupio Safety
pyupio_safety.description: Safety checks Python dependencies for known security vulnerabilities.

quality_time.name: Quality-time
quality_time.description: Quality report software for software development and maintenance.

url.help: URL of the Quality-time instance, with port if necessary, but without path. For example, 'https://quality-time.example.org'.

random.name: Random
random.description: A source that generates random numbers, for testing purposes.

robot_framework.name: Robot Framework
robot_framework.description: Robot Framework is a generic open source automation framework for acceptance testing, acceptance test driven development, and robotic process automation.

url.name: URL to a Robot Framework report in XML format or a zip with Robot Framework reports in XML format

landing_url.name: URL to a Robot Framework report in a human readable format

test_result.name: Test result
test_result.help: Limit which test results to count. Note: depending on which results are selected, the direction of the metric may need to be adapted. For example, when counting passed tests, more is better, but when counting failed tests, fewer is better.

sonarqube.name: SonarQube
sonarqube.description: SonarQube is an open-source platform for continuous inspection of code quality to perform automatic reviews with static analysis of code to detect bugs, code smells, and security vulnerabilities on 20+ programming languages.

url.name: URL
url.help: URL of the SonarQube instance, with port if necessary, but without path. For example, 'https://sonarcloud.io'.

component.name: Project key
component.help: The project key can be found by opening the project in SonarQube and looking at the bottom of the grey column on the right.

branch.name: Branch (only supported by commercial SonarQube editions)

lines_to_count.name: Lines to count
lines_to_count.help: Either count all lines including lines with comments or only count lines with code, excluding comments.

test_result.name: Test result
test_result.help: Limit which test results to count. Note: depending on which results are selected, the direction of the metric may need to be adapted. For example, when counting passed tests, more is better, but when counting failed tests, fewer is better.

trello.description: Trello is a collaboration tool that organizes projects into boards.
